exchanges.user: check Paw Patrol on my NAS server to see if it downloaded properly.
exchanges.assistant:
I'm afraid I don't have access to your NAS server, sir. I'm not connected to any network storage or file systems beyond this local project directory.

To check on your Paw Patrol download, you'd need to either access the NAS directly through your file browser, or if you can provide me with a mounted path or SSH access to the server, I could take a look for you. Otherwise, this one's going to require your personal touch.
Very good, sir. Let me know if there's anything else I can help you with.

exchanges.user: Can you go on my NAS server and see if you can see why Paw Patrol is not downloading?
exchanges.assistant:
You've got about 318 Paw Patrol episodes on your server. Based on my investigation, here's the situation:

The downloads are working properly. This morning, Sonarr found and grabbed multiple Season 4 episodes and sent them to SABnzbd, which downloaded and unpacked them successfully. You've also got fresh Season 10 episodes that came in earlier today.

There are two minor hiccups I spotted. First, your DrunkenSlug indexer hit its API rate limit and is disabled until tomorrow afternoon. Second, Prowlarr had a brief database lock issue, but it seems to have cleared itself.

If specific episodes aren't downloading, it's likely because the indexers simply can't find releases for them. Some of those older Season 4 episodes returned "no results found" during the searches. That's unfortunately just the nature of Usenet - not everything stays available forever.

Is there a particular season or episode you're concerned about, sir?

I appreciate you thinking of me, sir, but I'm not equipped with news feeds or web browsing capabilities at the moment. I'm rather more of a technical assistant than a morning paper.

For today's headlines, you'd be better served by a proper news source or perhaps asking one of those general-purpose assistants who keep their finger on the pulse of current events.

Is there anything else I can help you with on the technical side of things?
